summary:
The Security Council,
 
1. Strongly supports the Kimberley Process Certification Scheme as a valuable contribution against trafficking in conflict diamonds and looks forward to its implementation, encouraging participants to resolve outstanding issues;
2. Welcomes the voluntary system of industry self-regulation described in the Interlaken Declaration; 
3. Stresses that the widest possible participation in the Kimberley Process Certification Scheme is essential, urging all Member States to actively participate. 
Noting with deep concern the linkage between illicit trade in rough diamonds and fuelling of armed conflicts, 
Recalling resolutions 1173 (1998), 1306 (2000), 1343 (2001), 1385 (2001) and 1408 (2002) to control illicit trade. 
Highlighting resolution 1295 (2000) welcoming the Interlaken Declaration of 5 November 2002. 
Expressing appreciation to Governments hosting Kimberley Process meetings and noting industry and civil society's contribution. 
Noting the decision to launch the Kimberley Process Certification Scheme on 1 January 2003.
